title: Easily Embed Documents and Files in an Excel Spreadsheet

steps.title: Click the cell into which you want to insert the object.
steps.content: Click the cell into which you want to insert the object. Whenever people view this cell, they will see the embedded document and can double-click on it to open that document. This method works for newer versions of Excel on either PC or Mac.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. You'll find this in the ribbon above the document editor or at the top of your screen.

steps.title: Click the icon that looks like a program window on a sheet of paper.
steps.content: Click the icon that looks like a program window on a sheet of paper. This is the "Object" icon and can be found in the "Text" group. A box will pop up.

steps.title: Click the Create from File tab.
steps.content: Click the Create from File tab. The tab will switch away from "Create New" and prompt you to use an already created file.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . Your file browser (Finder for Mac and File Explorer for Windows) will open.

steps.title: Navigate to and double-click your file.
steps.content: Navigate to and double-click your file. Only files you can use will display, like PowerPoints, PDFs, and Word documents.

steps.title: Choose how to display your embedded document.
steps.content: Choose how to display your embedded document. If you select "Display as icon," you'll see the icon of the document appear in the cell; if you don't choose "Display as icon," the full first page of the document will appear. In either case, both embedded document displays will redirect to the full document when double-clicked.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . You'll see this at the bottom right of the pop-up window. The document you selected will appear in the cell either as the full first-page document or icon. [1] X Research source
